articles.title: Passwordless Google accounts are here—you can now switch to passkey-only - Ars Technica
articles.description: Switching is probably a terrible idea right now, but you've got to start somewhere.
articles.content:
Enlarge/ Google says the login flow will go something like this, from left to right: type in your username, pick a passkey, scan a finger. Hopefully your device has biometrics.

articles.title: ESA Can't Deploy JUICE's Radar Antenna. It Needs It to Scan Under the Ice at Callisto, Europa, and Ganymede - Universe Today
articles.description: ESA technicians are still working to free the stuck RIME antenna on the JUICE spacecraft. So far, they've only moved it a little.
